job_to_be_done.statement: Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting first salary and end-of-service settlement

navigation_paths.path: Go to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation
Select calculation bases (custom days, calendar days, or working days)
Reject and resave prorated salary transactions if needed

claims_to_validate.claim_statement: Daily pay is calculated by dividing total salary (basic + allowance) by number of actual working days
Working days can be calculated using either calendar days (30 days) or actual working days (e.g., 22 days)
Public holidays must be subtracted from total working days when calculating daily pay rate
Daily pay calculation process requires approval of unpaid leave request before salary deduction
Daily pay deduction interacts with payroll, leave management, and employee record systems
Daily wage calculator can be accessed from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation
Calculation base can be selected from calendar days, working days, or custom days
Salary components can include basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only
Calendar days calculation uses total month days (e.g., 31 in January, 28 in February)
Working days exclude weekends and public holidays
Most UAE and KSA companies use 30 custom days for wage calculation
Daily wage calculator supports salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction

claims_to_validate: Super admin can select calculation basis for salary proration
Calculation bases include custom days, calendar days, and working days
Changes to proration affect all active (unpaid) payroll amounts
Open payroll months require manual transaction rejection before saving new settings
Salary proration impacts first salary and end-of-service settlement

rules_and_constraints: Changes will affect all active (unpaid) amounts in payroll table

outputs: Updated salary calculations proportionally adjusted based on selected calculation method
edge_cases: When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, super admin must manually reject and resave transactions
